instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: What is SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC? SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC is a voltage that is created if SMC_BC_ACOK & PP3V42_G3H are both present that powers the chipset for the onewire circuit that allows the SMC to talk to the charger on the SYS_ONEWIRE line. This is necessary for the magsafe charger to have a light on it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message:
Strange situation here. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no powering up no green light on charger.
checked voltage:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>:  12.64v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL>: 12.63v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>: 18.99v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.41v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 4.99v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>: 0.00v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message: ACOK? Known good magsafe board? Voltage on <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> : 18.80v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> :3.2v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL> :0.00v
checkedf with another magsafe board and is this same

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> 18.80V??? Really?? I'm pretty sure you are measuring the wrong pin...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message: Also with <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> at 3.2v <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL> should be 3.42V, is 3.42V present at <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> pin 5??? If yes, then should be a bad <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> and/or corroded trace...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message: i measure on testing point next to charger connector on main board. but when i measure on pin 5 on magsafe connector is 0.42v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="speedyaction, post: 27346"]<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> : 18.80v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> :3.2v
[SIZE=16px][COLOR=#FF0000]<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL> :0.00v[/COLOR][/SIZE]
checkedf with another magsafe board and is this same[/QUOTE]

If pin 4 from <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> is 3.40V then <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL> should be 3.40V  too, maybe you have a broken trace...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message:
18V on <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL>???? Double check please. 

DO NOT USE COMMENTS, make a reply

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message: Right now i cant trust on any of your measurements, please recheck all..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no green light on charger no powering up.
threads.message: ok. i done jumper from pin 5 on magsafe connector to <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin 5 and now motherboard is working :) thx for all guys . all of you give me little bit to think how is it work and now is powering up. Done!!!
